abstract.p: Helene Cote, executive vice president and executive creative director at New York office of Rapp Collins Worldwide, is named to new post of executive vice president and chief creative officer at Irving, Tex, office; Raymond Perrier is named managing director at Interbrand Corp; Jeffrey Parkhurst assumes Perrier's duties; Paul Vickers is named creative director (S)

block.p: Executives are changing posts at agencies owned by the Omnicom Group.

Helene Cote, executive vice president and executive creative director at the New York office of Rapp Collins Worldwide, was named to the new post of executive vice president and chief creative officer at the Irving, Tex. office. In her new post, Ms. Cote, 45, will oversee a creative staff of 65 employees on accounts like Dell Computer, J. C. Penney and SBC Communications.
Executives are changing posts at agencies owned by the Omnicom Group.

Helene Cote, executive vice president and executive creative director at the New York office of Rapp Collins Worldwide, was named to the new post of executive vice president and chief creative officer at the Irving, Tex. office. In her new post, Ms. Cote, 45, will oversee a creative staff of 65 employees on accounts like Dell Computer, J. C. Penney and SBC Communications.

Also, executives were named to new posts at the New York office of the Interbrand Corporation. Raymond Perrier, 34, global director for brand valuation at Interbrand, based in London, was named managing director, with responsibility for overseeing daily operations at the office. His duties in the Americas were taken over by Jeffrey Parkhurst, 41, who was named director for brand valuation for the Americas; Mr. Parkhurst had been manager for the consumer industries practice at A. T. Kearney in Chicago, a subsidiary of Electronic Data Systems. Also, Paul Vickers, 41, was named creative director; he had been principal and creative director at Vickers Design International in London.
